turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Clarkia modesta.
turn.2: Clarkia modesta Clarkia modesta is a species of flowering plant in the evening primrose family known by the common name Waltham Creek clarkia.
turn.4: It is endemic to California, where it is known from the woodlands of several of the central mountain ranges, including the North and Central Coast Ranges and the Sierra Nevada foothills.
turn.6: It is an erect annual herb often exceeding half a meter in height.
turn.7: What do the leaves look like?
turn.8: The oval, linear, or lance-shaped leaves are 2 to 4 centimeters long.
turn.9: What do the flowers look like?
turn.10: The inflorescence bears opening flowers and closed, hanging flower buds.
turn.12: The sepals remain fused as the petals bloom from one side.
